block.p: A memorial service for the historian Arthur M. Schlesinger Jr. will be held at 10:30 a.m. on April 23 in the Great Hall at Cooper Union, at Seventh Street and Third Avenue in Manhattan. The service is open to the public. Mr. Schlesinger, who wrote more than 20 books and won two Pulitzer Prizes, died on Feb. 28.

Among those scheduled to speak are former President Bill Clinton; Senator Edward M. Kennedy; the author Norman Mailer; former Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger; the author Theodore C. Sorensen, who, like Mr. Schlesinger, was an aide to President John F. Kennedy; the British historian Lord Hugh Thomas; William J. vanden Heuvel, a former American ambassador to the United Nations; and the historian Sean Wilentz.

Correction: April 17, 2007, Tuesday A brief report yesterday about a memorial service scheduled for April 23 for the historian Arthur M. Schlesinger Jr. included erroneous information from participants about who may attend. It is not open to the public; it is by invitation only.
